} } } Length:: 5:10 MinsSo going from a Canon T2i to this camera was a pretty big leap forward for me. I know that this camera is essential the same as the T4i with a small amount of tweaking so when it went on sale for $899.00 with the 18-135mm lens I jumped on it. I've used the lens on my T2i so I knew it was a great lens. Technically I ordered this lens for my T2i but after getting some responses from comments I posted from another review here I decided just to do a complete upgrade.I can't say enough about how good the T5i is but from the enhanced video mode to the very smooth focus it is just what you would expect from Canon. I also like the touch screen flip out. The screen resolution is also very good - smart phone quality good.The video covers just basic stuff like camera weight, the enhanced video mode and the touch screen.All in all a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR. All you need to have photo fun.
Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: Canon EOS Rebel T5i is a DSLR camera, that is a step above the Canon Rebel T3i. Let me use my usual disclaimer, and admit that with so many good cameras around, it is more about what mix of traits or features you are looking for.On that note, the camera's trait mix is as follows. It is a DSLR with 18 megapixels resolution. Probably the most important point for this class of cameras is the sensor size, which is APS-C. That's just one step below 35mm Full frame.It has an optical viewfinder, which works through a pentaprism. That is the classical SLR construction. You are using the properties of light to view the subject before and during the shot. The purists would argue this is the way it was supposed to be- that is, with minimal electronic intervention. As in most Canon DSLRs, it has a Dioptric adjustment to make it easy for people with glasses to use the viewfinder. Also, you can preview depth of field. The dust deletion mechanism includes a software adjustment for removing/modifying the affected pixels, self-cleaning sensor, and manual cleaning.The ISO rating is 25,600 which makes it work better in low light. The video is a Full HD- that is 1920x1080 resolution. The camera gives you the option to control the exposure  manually. It does have an external flash option. You would need that for portraits, at least. The LCD screen resolution is a whopping 1,040,000. It is also a touch-screen, and can be tilted for easy viewing in awkward situations. The sustainable burst rate- for fast action- is 5 frames per second. The camera also does RAW processing which is useful if you did not want to be limited by JPEG storage only. The camera body weighs 580 grams. This weight is quite standard compared to DSLRs of its class.The T5i has a couple of small, but significant changes over the T3i. It has a higher ISO rating, and a much improved LCD screen. Most importantly, it has a newer image processor- Digic 5 instead of Digic 4. The burst mode works well at 5 frames per second. That is higher than that of the T3i and SL1. Compared to the SL1, this has a faster drive system, which makes it somewhat heavier.A great camera, and its traits are a lot improved compared to its predecessors. If you are not trying to make this your profession, this is all you need.

Reviews.Title: upgrade from XTi
Reviews.Author: Tony K
Reviews.Content: I like the camera thus far...it was an upgrade from my old XTi.  I'm not a fan of the vari angle LCD screen.  I prefer the LCD screen to be flushed into the camera body.  it's just my preference, so far the image quality is outstanding and i enjoy using this when i take outdoors.Two features I also liked about this model.  It has a built in Speedlite transmitter.  Since i already have an older Speedlite 420ex...I was able to set the 420ex a slave unit and use the T5i built in flash as a transmitter or also a flash with the transmitter to control the 420ex from a distance.  I like this feature, this will probably make me want to invest later on the Speedlite 600ex-rt.Second, in self timer mode, you can shoot multiple shots, which i also love.  I think you can set the self timer to take like 10 shots continuously.  I like this, as when taking family shots, you don't have to run back and forth to set the self timer...plus, it helps me, as i am lazy to run back and forth to the camera.Overall, if you're looking for a beginner type DSLR, this is the one I prefer.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Ktravis4
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I researched all my options in this price range and went with theT5i . I am new to DSLR's, but have experience with 35 mm SLR's. I was using a Nikon P5000 point and shoot for about a year before upgrading. The difference in photo quality is significant at times, such as fast action..ie sports. This camera has lots of features to enhance your photography but it can seem overwhelming. I recommend you look up "camerarec toby" on youtube. He has great instructional videos on the T5i/T4i and other products and photography tips. All of this is free and will greatly reduce your learning curve. If your considering the T5i, I say go for it, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: A great camera easy to use
Reviews.Author: glass worker (hobby) guy
Reviews.Content: I owned an earlier Canon rebel, the XT that I used for eight years along with a Canon G-10. I love the ability to view the image on a movable screen before taking the picture. There are many modes to use in taking a picture and slowly I am learning all of them. I love macro photography and this camera makes it very easy. There is also a feature that allows you to just touch the screen where you want the camera to focus and the touch it again to actually take the picture. It's a great camera and I am enjoying using it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for New Photographers
Reviews.Author: Fadrique Rosales
Reviews.Content: 1. Delivery on time.2. Just as I expected.3. Very friedly menu for new photographers.4. With 18-135mm EF lens this camera takes excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: So many feature, I've had it so little time!!!
Reviews.Author: chuy jay
Reviews.Content: I am truly amazed of the quality of the pictures I've taken so far..Some auto, some with my adjustments.Newbie to the DSLR family, so trying to really get the feel for this camera, but the touch screen makes it oh much easier to review, adjust and change settings... I TRULY LOVE THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Dianna M Brown
Reviews.Content: Great camera...  I'm finally able to capture good pictures of my kids in their various sporting events.  I even have other parents asking me to snap some shots for them!  Love it.

Reviews.Title: 10 zooms outta 10 D<<<<<<<<<<<
Reviews.Author: Movieskinny "WayneG"
Reviews.Content: HISTORY_This is my first SLR camera of any kind. My first was a 1960s Brownie Kodak that used 110 film, then it was a 1980s Canon 35mm point n shoot, someone gave me a 1990s Fujifilm 2mp camera to get in the age of digital, the 2000s got more efficient with a Kodak P880 8mp semi-pro camera which was an awesome camera(they still sell for $100), and then Amazon forced me to get a Canon T5i. OK, not quite at gun point, but the deal was ridiculously good. After watching a YouTube review of the T3i vs. T5i, it was NO contest.1st THOUGHTS_Canon almost got me on a 60x point n shoot at Costco, but I payed the bigger bucks, and am not sorry. I thought my Kodak pics with the nice S&K; lens were great, but these are WOW. The only pictures that don't turn out and look great are the ones I have been setting up on manual, which produces wonderful results with a little more trial and error.PICTURES_I got it with only the stock 18-55mm lens and some of the Macro shots of spring blossoms fill an HDTV space with jaw dropping colorific pics. I just ordered the $10 macro reversing ring to play around with some superduper close-ups without having to spend $3-400 on the real macro stuff. Just about everything set on auto that I've taken turns out sharp and clear, and seemed dud-proof. My friends are not the SLR owning crowd and have been very praising of the few shots I have shared.CAMERA BODY_I'm a big guy, the camera is surprisingly light, and is not a problem to wander around with this hanging about your neck or in a side bag. Construction seems to be of strong gauge plastic with not much metal visible. Strap is very comfy too. There is NO(?) connector string for the lens cap. Spinning and flipout color screen is very useful. I have already used it for taking pics at goofy angles which make using the eye piece impossible. Controls, buttons, and switches are layed out nicely, The on-off switch and selector wheels literally feel like a Fisher-Price Toy they are so solidly built, and seem like they may last a while. Nothing on the camera feels flimsy. The battery is doubled locked in it's compartment, which I thought was an impressive touch. One drop and most batteries will barge their way out of a camera and damage the door.WHAT'S INSIDE_Having read many reviews before purchasing this unit, I really liked the difference between the Canon and Nikon, and the ones that put me over to Canon, fast action photography and ease of controls use. Watch any sporting event and the only lenses you see on the sidelines are white Canon lenses for fast action play. The reviews appear to be correct. I read the manual on my Kindle, computer, and the book for the first week. I tried to get up to speed, and the software and controls on the camera were very simple to follow. The camera actually gives you multiple ways to accomplish a software change with wheels, direction buttons, and a super nice touch screen display. Touch screen is one of the best parts of the camera. I tell people to read directions, do they listen, no. I do, and it makes difference no matter what the electronics. Go to YouTube and watch videos, it helps a lot.The battery charges fully in 1-2 hours. Having had the Kodak P880 before this did help ease into learning how to operate the camera. Read the directions and take pictures of anything as you go and see what they look like. I poked my head out the front door and took a handheld 3 second night exposure of streaky car traffic lights. A little unfocused but I learned how to do it when I have tripod in hand. I went back through some initial pics and post effected them with grainy BW or amped colors for some very nice artsy visuals. The software also defaults to save your original pic. The software discs that comes in the box provide manuals, and very good picture editing tools. They call them professional, but it isn't Adobe, I know that much, and does all I need it to do.HD VIDEO_I may add to this later. The STM lens focusing system is a must for video. I watched a YouTube video and the focusing is silent compared to lenses of the past. Even the USM lenses were adding noise to the video, just like my old Kodak did. I have turned it on, and the STM focusing is as advertised, quiet! The T5i is STM approved. T3i...NOT.FINAL NOTES_Even if you just use the no-brainer settings, the camera is well worth it. With IS(image stabilization), new STM(works on a sliding principle) lens focusing, and other Canon technology, the T5i will make your memories foolproof. There are pros doing reviews here on more technical items and I will not try to offer that level of reflection. I know how to build a great computer, but have no where near mastered what this T5i is capable of. Many reviews say this is a good starter $700 camera, and I believe them now, but like the computers I build, you need to do more than check mail. AND read the directions!! Professional photographers are spending thousands on just the body of a camera. I'm not there yet, or maybe never. Right now, the T5i, looks pro enough.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, love my new T5i
Reviews.Author: CountryBoy
Reviews.Content: Finally I upgraded to the new Canon T5i digital with the 18-135mm lens from my old original version Canon Rebel. The images are sharp and have a lot of snap. I shoot in the Raw + Large (JPG) format so I can get a JPG image right away if necessary and even recording two images, a total of about 30mb, I can still get 3 shots in a burst. Unlike other digitals that I have used, I've never had to wait for the camera to download the buffer to the memory card before I could shoot again. I'm using a 32gb UHS SD Card and even capturing two images at a time, I can still get almost 900 images on the card.The only complaint I have so far is that shooting in full automatic in bright sunlight causes the flash to fire because it is trying to do a fill flash. But if you run it in Program mode, it doesn't do that. The problem it causes me is that when you are wearing a baseball cap as most do in the west, the flash can't pop all the way up as it hits the bill of your cap and the camera just makes clicking noises. But it's not a big deal, just put the mode into "P" and you're good to go.Just shot around 200 pictures at Las Vegas' Fremont Experience at night and was blown away with the quality of the shots I got. The camera did a good job dealing with the contrast of night plus neon lighting in all areas except where it was black then the neon lights were burned out. But this only happened when I was at the edge of area and shooting away towards the dark parts of the city. Even got some good pictures of Elvis and I had heard that he died. Guess that's what I get for believing everything I read on the internet.This is my first camera with an image stabilized lens and it seems to work pretty good while shooting low light subjects at slow shutter speeds.If you want a good camera that is close to a professional version but much more affordable, I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent DSLR for the family man/woman!
Reviews.Author: StringsAttached
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after realizing I was missing photographs when using my Nikon super zoom. I originally purchased the kit with the 18-55mm EF-S IS STM lens and the EF-S 55-250mm lens. I realized after about three days that switching lenses so often was not worth it and bumped up to the 18-135mm.My wife and I are expecting and I wanted something that would take great photos and video and would be easy to use. The T5i has exceeded my expectations so far. If you're moving up from a point-and-shoot or super zoom, this camera is a great introduction into the DSLR world. It is also easy to use and takes great video.If you're like me, you've researched many DSLRs in this price range and you may be having a difficult time picking one. Plus, you've heard the T5i doesn't offer much of an upgrade over the T4i/T3i for the money. Trust me, don't waste your time. Buy this camera if you want an excellent DSLR for photos and video. If you want to just take photos, then those other points matter. Otherwise, this camera has the features you want and you won't think twice about the money you spent when you see the images you'll capture. The other thing I really love about this camera is that I know it will be able to handle me when my photography skills demand more in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Grace
Reviews.Content: I took the camera out for a trial run today and love the results. The photos are so sharp, and that's with not doing anything special - just using the auto-settings. The lens I used was the 18-135mm IS STM. The camera size and weight are perfect for me (small hands). I've been using Canon EOS cameras for many years and this one replaces my 60D which is a great camera, but too large and heavy.

Reviews.Title: Great starter DSLR
Reviews.Author: Marc Ramsey
Reviews.Content: It's great as a starter dslr, but I am quicky out growing it as I am getting serious about photography.  I'm now looking for something more like a Canon 70DAlso, the kit lens is pretty cheap (as to be expected) and I am also about to replace that with a 17-55 as soon as I get the cash.For the beginner, go for it, but if you already have experience with a dSLR and want to upgrade, I'd say, go with a 70D.

Reviews.Title: Great Product and as describe!
Reviews.Author: Lwin
Reviews.Content: This camera is really nice and good quality. Shipping is fast and everything is there what it has to be. This camera makes tons of beautiful pictures so far. I am not a professional photographer but may be one day. ;)  A lot of my friend told me the pictures are very very nice and ask me " Did you take these pictures with professional camera?" So, I would recommend this product to you and this seller!

Reviews.Title: Best little cameral for the money
Reviews.Author: S. Hart "S. Hart"
Reviews.Content: I sold my EO5 (too big) and bough this one. I love it! Its very intuitive and the touch screen that is movable makes changing the settings  a breeze. It comes with all you need to get started and its lightweight design makes is a pleasure to carry for those special events. My old Canon was a pain to haul around! 18 MP! Wow

Reviews.Title: Loving it.
Reviews.Author: Edward
Reviews.Content: The camera was for my grandson, he uses it for college and personal work. He was very happy witn the product.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: AlwaysLoyal
Reviews.Content: still in the process of working with it got it for digital video productions and photography but i defentily need to get a better lense

Reviews.Title: good updated camera
Reviews.Author: chrisl
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for an older rebel xs.  It is a very good updated camera.  I think that it was a good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: Wow what a great camera.
Reviews.Author: Agnusdei
Reviews.Content: I've only had this for over a month and I'm loving it. I can understand the review here and in youtube where they say how it's the same version as the t4i, but for someones like me who had a 30d for the longest time this is a major upgrade. If you're a canon fan and have been using older version of their SLR you wont be disappointed. I did not go technical here because you can find great reviews of this camera on youtube which you can see it better.

Reviews.Title: Action!
Reviews.Author: Leslie
Reviews.Content: I had the T2i and as far as taking still shots, it was perfectly fine. But I take lots of action shots. You can't beat this camera! I took it to the shooting range and got some awesome shots today! I can't wait to take it to races now. Make sure you have the Extreme Pro memory card so that you get the full performance. But I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.  I would change the design of one thing though.
Reviews.Author: M. gobble
Reviews.Content: When you toggle the power on if you push it too far it turns on video, argh!  Otherwise it's a great camera for the price.  I chose it over the 7D as I felt like I was getting something almost as good for a lot cheaper.  It has some gimmicky bells and whistles I don't use, but that's fine.  I just don't use them (flip screen, touch screen, ect)

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Z. Douglas
Reviews.Content: Canon's Rebel T5i may be just incrementally improved over a well-based T3i/T4i, but as a novice, I've thoroughly enjoyed learning photography on this model.  It's just "pro" enough to feel pleased with my work, and the extensive functionality available even in Automatic shooting mode make it hard to take a bad shot.

Reviews.Title: Professionals Quality
Reviews.Author: Dale Pilla
Reviews.Content: This camera is totally of professional quality, and I have not even learned how to use it to it's full potential!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! Recommend for photo and video
Reviews.Author: Penny C.
Reviews.Content: This a phenomenal camera beginners and intermediate photographers and videographers alike trying learn. It takes great still and good video. The video does leave a little sharpness to be desired but this is the case with most canon DSLRs. I

Reviews.Title: It meets my needs very well
Reviews.Author: MDtiger
Reviews.Content: This camera and lense combination is just what I need.  The camera with touch screen is easy to use for an amatuer like me.  The 18-125mm lense is perfect for traveling.  Not too heavy and meet sightseeing needs.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Keith E. Tucker
Reviews.Content: I am a month in using this camera, I upgraded from a Canon Rebel xt, the first digital camera that had enough megapixels, 8, to take photos that were able to be blown up to 8 by 10 without pixelating. The T5i is so much clearer with 18.meg I am able to zoom in on a prints and still see details. Still learning the ins and outs of the various modes this camera gives me but love the challenge of mastering the process.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for its price
Reviews.Author: Danno
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera if you are a fan of the Rebel series by canon. I  upgraded from the XS to this T5I and Love everything I've shot with this camera, while the lay out of the camera is a little different from the XS,it didn't take me long to adjust to the few changes... only thing I would like to be improved on is the fact that there is a recording time cap of 30 minutes, when this becomes null and void this series camera will be unstoppable

Reviews.Title: Great beginner camera
Reviews.Author: H Hall
Reviews.Content: I did some film photography in college, and I was tired of my Canon G12 point-and-shoot never quite getting the shot I wanted.After a few days with the T5i, I'm really happy.  I can experiment with exposure in manual mode, but I can also just switch to auto and snap away, knowing I'll get at least a passable shot.If you're just looking for a point-and-shoot and you want a nice image, there are plenty of cheaper, smaller cameras for you.  If you are looking to step up into "real" photography, then this camera provides a good starting point.

Reviews.Title: Awesome results with small footprint
Reviews.Author: mountain guy
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR camera that I purchased reluctantly just before our Maui trip last week.  Have not used a SLR in 10+ years- just point and shoot.  Read the manual on the plane trip over- pretty straight forward.Best decision ever!!  This camera is very lightweight and small with the 18-55 kit lens and takes absolute stunning pics if you use the right settings.  Sunset family portraits with fill-in flash came out incredible - also used an old ef-300mm lens from my old film canon slr with a polarizer for whales jumping and got surprising shots in sports mode.  As others have stated, the touch screen really speeds things up when you're changing scenes/ lighting etc- very useful.  Love using live-view- good visibility even in sunlight.

Reviews.Title: Great Product.
Reviews.Author: Dwight McCalla
Reviews.Content: Bought this setup to take pictures of my new born and family. worked great for me. haven't used it much since the birth due to new job but will be using it a lot in the future.

Reviews.Title: Very good all around camera.
Reviews.Author: Thomas Fretch
Reviews.Content: If you are trying to keep cost reasonable, but want to do video and still photography with one camera, this may be the one for you.  It is as close to a pro camera as you can get without buying one.  It will do almost everything cameras costing much more will do, but with auto settings available to you so you don't have to be a pro photographer.  As you learn more, it allows you to switch over to manual shooting if you want.

Reviews.Title: Great for first-time buyer
Reviews.Author: Jeff Meyers
Reviews.Content: First time DSLR buyer: awesome camera and kit lens for the price.  The sensor is more than capable of producing great images.  The kit lens is actually not all that bad compared to the kit lens that came with my 50d.  The focusing is virtually silent.  The optics are not that bad.  As a first time DSLR camera / kit lens combo, 5/5 stars for most amateur applications.Needing video capability: again, awesome camera and kit lens for the price.  It is more than capable of producing great video for most amateur applications.Upgrading from a previous DSLR: UPGRADE YOUR LENSES FIRST.  Every situation is different.  Here is mine.  I have a 5 year old 50d that is not broken.  It still takes great pictures.  I got sucked into the hype of owning a new camera.  There certainly are improvements in the sensor and image processor, however I took pictures with identical lenses and settings on my old and new camera.  There was barely any difference unless you zoomed in to the pixel level.  Subjectively, most people actually preferred the images from my 50d (without knowing which was which).  I don't shoot video that often so that was not a selling point for me.  I returned the T5i and purchased a 24-105 f/4 L lens instead.

Reviews.Title: I really like the canon T5i
Reviews.Author: Kannan Ramamoorthy
Reviews.Content: I am a beginner photographer. This entry level DSLR satisfies all my needs. I just bought the body and got a prime lens for the body. awesome camera. Got loads of features. still lot more to explore. I would definitely recommend this to others. four of my friends bought the same model and we are really happy with the image quality and performance...really fun to use..

Reviews.Title: So far, the wife likes it...
Reviews.Author: Michael S. Bauer
Reviews.Content: My wife used to be a professional photographer, but 3 kids later she hasn't really touched her DSLR in years.  Recently, the kids school has had her taking photos up there with their T3i.  She has gone on and on about how she loves using it.  So, for Christmas I got her the updated T5i.The nice thing with the Canons are their compatibility.  My wife graduated with a degree in Photography, and back then we had a choice: Canon or Nikon.  We went Canon because back then Canons had a much better reputation of maintaining compatibility with their accessories.Years later, that seems to still hold true.  All the old EOS lenses we still moved perfectly from my wife's 10D to this.  Even the SpeedLite she has seems to work perfectly.  Back then, when shooting film, it made more sense to put your money into higher-quality lenses since the same film was going into the body regardless.  Since digital is a little more like shooting slide film, and the quality of the camera body greatly influences the quality of the sensor and the post image processing, that's not so much the case anymore but it was back then.They did change out the battery, and it now uses SD cards instead of Compact Flash cards, but that's simply progress.I was debating on getting her the lower-end Pro model, but I ended up with this because, well, she really doesn't need a pro camera anymore.  If she ever decides to go into business again, I can rest assured that most of the investments we have made will work on whatever the latest/greatest Canon is at the time.  She really likes the large touch screen, and I like how Canon has gone to all pro-style function knobs at the top.  I miss having a magnesium-alloy body, but my understanding is that Canon is going all-plastic on all their models moving forward, so I guess we all had better get used to it.  The eye piece is also not quite as nice as the pro models, but it does offer the ability to adjust the focus some for those who wear glasses.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price!
Reviews.Author: Chuck "CMB"
Reviews.Content: Perfect machine! I am mainly using this for my YouTube channel and I am very happy with the quality and performance. Right now, I am having a little trouble with manual sound recording through an external mic but I think the problem is not about the camera but about me (or the extension cord I bought). Somehow, I am just recieving mono sound in the videos, although my mic is stereo. Hopefully it is not about the camera. I will let you know when I find out.Anyways, definitely a great camera for this price. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: Best Canon Rebel Digital SLR Camera Yet!
Reviews.Author: Marchwind1949
Reviews.Content: This is the best Canon Rebel yet!!  I ordered it in July, and since receiving it, I have consistently been pleased with the quality of photos and ease of use for this camera!

Reviews.Title: love my new t5i
Reviews.Author: bayly
Reviews.Content: awesome camera great shutter speed and the image is amazing and very reasonably priced (: of course the default lens isn't my favorite but I bought a 50 mm and my pictures turn out fantastic!!!! the camera itself is a bit heavy but nothing to neck killing. overall i don't have a single complaint about it.

Reviews.Title: Very functional!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Quass
Reviews.Content: love love love. Great for any beginner and also for many who know how to play with manual mode. The camera's LCD monitor is great. It's touch screen and it clips out so you can take your silly "selfies", low angle and high angle without having to bend down or stand on a stool. It's awesome.

Reviews.Title: Amazing photos from a novice
Reviews.Author: rachel
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything all other posts promise.. I am a novice  at the new DSL cameras and it has been simple to use. I can say that I did get the dummy book which was very helpful and I am only one page 93 and taking great pictures the quality is truly amazing. Super happy with my purchase. BTW I did get the upgraded lens it was worth it. Do not go with the bundle. Spend your money on better lens.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Lee E Benz
Reviews.Content: It does so many things my canon EOS-20D did not do and does many things better. I like the larger LCD and also low light capabilities

Reviews.Title: Great amateur's DSLR!
Reviews.Author: Brendan Wang "Bear Wolf"
Reviews.Content: I'm equipping my T5i with a Canon 18-200mm f/3.5-5.6 lens, Fotodiox EW-78D hood, and Zeikos 72mm filters! The articulating screen is amazing! I find myself using it a lot; however, be prepared to bring batteries along! I generally put it in manual settings and automatic ISO and that seems to be pretty good!The stereo mics pick up sound from a great distance; perhaps 50ft +. The navigation controls on the face of the camera are super useful too! (One of the reasons why I chose this instead of the 60D!) The flash is decent; but then again, I would rather buy a mountable flash. I'm not going into too detailed a review; others have already done that. What I can say though, is that this is a great camera with great features for the enthusiast in you. Grip is nice, got the right ports, etc. I'm so glad that I bought this camera!

Reviews.Title: New to dSLR, not new to photography
Reviews.Author: medgirl
Reviews.Content: Got this camera a few weeks ago and have been experimenting ever since- so far I love it!  I have borrowed friends' and family's older Canon models, which take great photos, but I do enjoy some of the features this camera offers, such as the mobile touchscreen for when you are trying to get a shot that the viewfinder is difficult to see through for.  I'd recommend it, figuring out the different settings and how to get the camera to get the shot you are looking for is quite simple!

Reviews.Title: Great for the enthusiast!
Reviews.Author: Jovon Fletcher "jmf777"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my father as an upgrade to his older T3.  It's a nice little camera, with canons newest Digic5 processor.  It can take some very clean images.  It is touchscreen and it's worth noting that the eyepiece has a proximity sensor so the touchscreen turns off when you bring the camera to your eye.  So need to worry about accidentally changing settings with your nose!  The menu is just as easy to navigate as Canon's other consumer/enthusiast grade cameras and it's not cluttered up with confusing buttons.  It's a very straight forward DSLR that can take great pictures!  The body has a bit more weight than my fathers old T3 which is nice, and helps balance the weight out better when using longer lenses.  All in all, I can't think of anything negative to say about this product and would highly recommend it to a beginner/enthusiast photographer.

Reviews.Title: No complaints!
Reviews.Author: M.Timlake
Reviews.Content: Since I have gotten this camera, I can barely set it down.  I am not an expert, and won't compare this to other past models (there are enough of those informative reviews).  The reason I bought the newer version, it was only $50 more than the older T4i.  Not much of a reason, but that is the truth.  I am still learning some of the key features, but am having so much fun with this camera, it has become an extension of me.  I won't leave home without it!Having a budget I needed to adhere to, I bought the body separately.  I wanted to buy a quality camera, and knew I could buy the better lenses as I am able to afford it. I already had 2 old lenses from a Canon Rebel Ti (non digital) that I read were compatible (35mm-80mm and 80mm-200).  I bought an extension tube from Fotodiox (less than $40) that I can use both of these "old" lenses with to get up close Macro shots.  The autofocus is disabled with the tube, but it is not difficult to find the range if you are willing to play with it in manual focus.I later bought a 50mm 1.8 lens that I could not be happier with. (Under $150)  It takes beautiful Bokeh shots that I put no effort into. The images are super sharp. The background gets that blur that makes your subject stand out.  I noticed even some of the poorly framed shots look amazing with this lens.  This little lens has been great for shooting people, animals, flowers, bugs, landscapes, things in action or at rest.  A beginner's must have in the photog bag.This camera works with cheaper, less fancy/expensive lenses and still does a great job.  I can't wait to build up to some of the higher quality lenses and see where this takes me.  This camera has given me nothing to complain about!  Quality is great.  No malfunctions.  Everything works beautifully.  Highly recommend for anyone who enjoys taking photos.

Reviews.Title: Flash Buzzing sound
Reviews.Author: N
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Canon T5i and when I hold the shutter button half way down to focus, the flash makes a buzzing sound and goes off. I read some reviews that T3i flash has the same issue. This is my second T5i. The first one did not have the flash buzzing sound issue but when I used automatic mode the flash did not always pop up in low light, sometimes it would pop up and sometimes it wouldn't. I returned it and got the second camera with the flash bussing sound.  I like the camera overall but am disappointed that the flash has these issues.

Reviews.Title: Great Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Kalani
Reviews.Content: I also upgraded from the Canon Rebel XTi.  I got it for the live view viewfinder. (I'm legally blind, it's much easier to compose using live view) I was surprised how much I use the touchscreen.  Because I already have lenses for my XTi I decided to stick with canon.  The quiet 18-55 lens is amazing.There was more noise in low light photos shot at very high ISO than I expected.  Maybe if I had used flash it would have been better.I recommend this camera to anyone interested in a model they can use as a serious amateur or start out and grow with.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy !
Reviews.Author: Joseph S. Borrow
Reviews.Content: For the value, a great camera.  Takes unbelievable videos with a steady-cam and a large card... I am sure there are better cameras out there BUT NOT FOR THE PRICE. Save money on the Camera and invest in the lenses.

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing
Reviews.Author: Scott Richard
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this camera from the t3 and couldn't be happier. Be sure to do the camera package and get the 18-135 lens at the same time. It's more expensive but you save $200 on the lens and trust me you will love it. I use this camera for real estate and the next purchase will be the wide angle 10-22mm canon lens! I also use a stm 40mm pancake lens for video of the home and it works well too. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Larry Mauriello "LDM"
Reviews.Content: Big change from point and shoot. This camera give you plenty of creativity. Also lots of room to grow as a photographer.

Reviews.Title: Completely amazing
Reviews.Author: Jose Aponte
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of film cameras, namely my Canon AE-1. This is my first DSLR and I'm in love with it.

Reviews.Title: So impressed with my camera
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Roth
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. I love the touch display and shooting pictures in low light at track meets and soccer games and still get great photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for beginning DSLR user
Reviews.Author: Alex Antonov
Reviews.Content: Even though I've been only using this camera for 2 months, I like it a lot. For a beginner it is great to be able to use full auto mode, but also to gradually experiment and transition to manual shooting via using Creative Auto capability which lets you adjust settings that you want leaving the rest on auto.

Reviews.Title: Canon t5i
Reviews.Author: Justin Bunn
Reviews.Content: The camera out of the box with a decent SD card can produce excellent photographs with little effort. I have had no problems so far.

Reviews.Title: T5i great and easy to use
Reviews.Author: John Weicherding
Reviews.Content: I love new features particularly the lcd being fold out and protected screen big improvement. Easy to use and great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade from my Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: Photobuff
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything I expected and a great upgrade from my 5 year-old Rebel XS.  It is set up in much the same way as my old camera and all the new features (touch screen, tilt screen, higher ISO ratings, etc.) work well and are easy to learn.

Reviews.Title: it is worth spending money
Reviews.Author: neeraj
Reviews.Content: I love this camera,  I traveled Jamaica with my canon and it captured my trip perfectly.  I am happy that I bought this one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: zoolander214
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR and I love it. Easy to use, great image quality, and hasn't broken down at all so far. Manual is easy to understand and it's light enough to carry anywhere. Highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Sevag Kouyoumjian
Reviews.Content: yes the cam is amazing, it has lots of options that i can use in every single event, location, etc. and gives me all the possible effect the i can get

Reviews.Title: Worth Every Penny!
Reviews.Author: Babbie
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera!  This is my first DSLR and I have to say, I love it.  I was an avid photographer for years but with a 35 mm Canon Rebel.  I missed taking pictures and finally decided it was time.  After a year researching and talking with other hobbiest, I decided on the T5i.  I actually borrowed a friend's T3i and both cameras were easy to use and I was surprised at the results, some pretty fantastic pictures.  My only preference between the two was the touch screen on the T5i.  So if you're wanting a user friendly camera, this one is for you!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: JanP
Reviews.Content: Am just beginning into the world of SLR cameras but am quite happy with the purchase.  The lenses I have used on it - also from Canon - produce outstanding photographs.  Recommend the corresponding "for Dummies" book - it has been very helpful in learning about my camera in an informative and easy to understand way.

Reviews.Title: Bought this.
Reviews.Author: Lover of life
Reviews.Content: Love this camera...although being a novice photographer, there's a lot to learn about how it works. Won't ever use all the features. Wish there were more detailed instructions. Takes great video.

Reviews.Title: First DSLR Camera
Reviews.Author: Debbie Hernandez
Reviews.Content: I am in love with my new Canon T5i DSLR Camera!  I did soooo much research before finally deciding to get this camera!  I love the touchscreen and how I can pull it out and twist it!  Great for selfies!  I have always liked taking pictures of random things but my point and shoot cameras never made my pictures come out good.  I have 16 month old girl so this camera is perfect to snap pictures of her!  I am still learning how to use every function it comes with.  I have taken it to Disneyland a few times and I love how my pictures have turned out! I recommend it to anybody that is new to DSLR's!

Reviews.Title: Thank you for being professional on your camera knowledge.
Reviews.Author: Lisa Benach
Reviews.Content: Great help from K and M on this camera with a receipt and warranty.Been on the phone all morning and it was well worth it.Lisa

Reviews.Title: Professional grade for the amateur photographer
Reviews.Author: Steven C Jordan
Reviews.Content: The T5i has been incredible so far with so much more to learn and do.  The build is amazing, with an astonishing capture ability that spreads the spectrum from dark to bright, fast action to long exposure. Truly a great step for the amateur photographer who is looking to step up from the cell phone quality, and experience the art of photography.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have bought yet!
Reviews.Author: CBear82
Reviews.Content: I love this camera...and all the Rebel series but this one is so far the best. very easy to shoot and use. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen Choi
Reviews.Content: This camera has been great to learn on. The many features on it make for an easy use. Sleek design creates a great feel in the users hand. Huge thumbs up for the amazon customer rep who was instrumental in the purchasing of this item. Great service and great product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Great deal and it shipped fast! This camera is of great quality as well. While I do wish the lense it came with could zoom further, it'll suffice until I save for a new lense!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera although it's not much different from the other Ti series
Reviews.Author: hummingbird
Reviews.Content: I bought this T5i for higher FPS while shooting hummingbirds.However, it's about the same as my T2i so that was a bit disappointing, but I do love the camera & am glad I bought it so I could give my T2i to a friend who is in need of a better camera than her cheapy point & shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Karen "AZ Mom"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera as an upgrade from my T3 and it is MUCH better than the T3. I am in no way a professional photographer, I just wanted a good camera that would take great pictures of my kids. The T3 would be hit or miss with quality photos, often times blurry. The T5i almost always take perfect pictures that are clear and great quality. I also bought the Canon EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS II Telephoto Zoom Lens and it is amazing. I highly recommend this camera as an entry level DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ash
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd DSLR (I upgraded) and I love it. Its a great camera. I think Canon keeps getting better and better.

Reviews.Title: So glad I purchased
Reviews.Author: Carrie Minton
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research I purchased the t5i and I am  very happy with my pictures and quality.  My first adventure out was a sporting event and I couldn't have been more pleased.  I also purchased the EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6IS II.  It was perfect for those up close shots.

Reviews.Title: it is the best.
Reviews.Author: Mohammed AlsayedKadhem
Reviews.Content: i did like Canon T5I. it is sure about good. I love Canon is smart and fast. it is hard heavy

Reviews.Title: Love love love!
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely in love with this camera.  The ability to change settings through touch screen is the best thing ever.

Reviews.Title: I love my canons
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I am a Canon girl. Haven't worked with any other brand. I really like this camera. Being able to move the screen is great. Not really a fan of the touchscreen, but you aren't limited to just the touchscreen. I like the special features, like fisheye, black and white, etc. I have also caught myself getting carried away, and flipping to video instead of on. A simple click will do that. Not a huge deal though.

Reviews.Title: Great for beginner!
Reviews.Author: Colleen Bailey
Reviews.Content: Bought the t5i body for my husband to get started with proper photography. This camera is amazing! So many features for him to work with but still simple enough that I can pick it up for a quick snapshot. We bought a separate 50mm lens and the photos are just amazing.

Reviews.Title: Love it, love it, love it!
Reviews.Author: Jacob E. Sammer
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera. The autofocus is intuitive, if not sometimes slow in automatic mode to focus. The face following focus it amazing and functioned much better than our other camera did. The touch screen works well and it's easy to navigate the menus. Image quality is top rate. The only thing that bothers me about Canon is why they constantly mess with the control layouts. Every model seems to have a different way to shoot video. It's crazy!

Reviews.Title: Ideal for me.
Reviews.Author: DRADDY
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate. The touch screen and arrangement of functions is very user friendly. Excellent picture quality. Fast auto-focus.  I am not a professional. Perfect for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Loving It!!
Reviews.Author: Dalilscorpio
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced a previous Pentax DSLR that I owned.  It was a definite upgrade and I can see the difference in the sporting event pictures that I take.  Continuous shooting is much faster and not blurred.  Definitely happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade from old rebel
Reviews.Author: Anne H. Palyok "Pet Lover"
Reviews.Content: i love my new camera. I upgraded from an older version and this new one was an easy transition. Instead of completely revising the camera, it has been enhanced and modernized. It functions basically the same as my older version, but with added benefits such as the Hd movie function. I love Canon cameras and they have never let me down when taking photographs.

Reviews.Title: FABULOUS!
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Durant
Reviews.Content: I have been using the 300D - this camera is the 700D  ...  what an upgrade!  Smaller, lighter and MUCH easier to use.  One of the things that I love about CANON equipment, one is able to interchange many of the add-ons.  It is also compatible with SIGMA & TAMRON lenses, all excellent buys.  I would recommend this particular camera to anyone who loves to just go out in the fresh air and click away or to the pro or semi-pro.  Excellent photos and fun and easy to use.  I bought mine on AMAZON, it arrived quickly, nicely packaged with a battery, charger and manuals and cost $200+ less than my camera shop that I use from time to time.  I just needed to buy the body due to my lenses all being compatible.  The only thing that differed is the memory card, which is very reasonably priced and can be bought at Walmart.

Reviews.Title: Loving It
Reviews.Author: James A. McDavitt
Reviews.Content: I’m an amateur camera buff at best, but I’m learning to love this unit.  This was the best “body only” buy that I’ve found on the net and that is after a considerable amount of research.  Very quick ship on this unit.

Reviews.Title: Easy to learn to use, excellent pictures.
Reviews.Author: gary landry
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from a point and shoot and never looked back.  This camera is very easy to use and take great pictures

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Kyle Anthony Davis
Reviews.Content: would buy another if needed works great and is worth the cost is very useful and happy to have it

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Brenda L. Weber
Reviews.Content: Exactly what my daughter wanted. Has all the features she uses and very happy with the quality of the pictures from this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love my Canon
Reviews.Author: acehan80
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, very proud to be a canon owner. I bought the body only, it came quick, and does what a camera does, I use it for video and photos, Its a step up from my T3i, a little over priced by about sixty dollars for just a camera body,  but an overall solid camera, The movie mode on this camera is spectacular, and I havent scratched the surface yet, get a good storage card, so you wont have to worry about the card not keeping up with the transfer of data from the camera. I will be purchasing this again, I want a second body, for other angles, does what higher end cameras do, so stop waiting, get you one!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: teacherfan
Reviews.Content: I bought for my wife for our 9th anniversary and it works great. The quality of the photos are excellent. I like that her lenses work perfectly with this.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.
Reviews.Author: Karen Babineaux
Reviews.Content: Camera has met all expectations.  It was a gift and they really love it. A great little canera. Cheaper than Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: super camera
Reviews.Author: Paul Herbert
Reviews.Content: Ver solid high quality feel, super fast focus and easy controls. the intelligent aug mode provides great results, and the scenes settings let one easily optimize sunset and night shots.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Pieske
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera to shoot photos and video in low light that would make most people cringe.This is a Fantastic Camera and the fact that you can turn the touchscreen around is a bonus.I LOVE THIS CAMERA!!

Reviews.Title: Satisfied and happy snapping everyone.
Reviews.Author: AP
Reviews.Content: I had T1i for a while and now this...big difference, from processing to view screen etc. I'm satisfied. What else can I say? I love this csmera!

Reviews.Title: Well worth the price!
Reviews.Author: Danica
Reviews.Content: Excellent pictures! We replaced our old Canon rebel (6 years old), and could not be happier with the upgrade. We are recreational photographers, mainly taking pictures of family vacations and the kids. Video ability is great too.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Arthur Redington Mulgrew
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this purchase, the Canon EOS Rebel T5i DSLR. It is leaps and bounds an upgrade over my last camera.

Reviews.Title: A SUPERB CAMERA AND AN EXCELLENT PRICE!
Reviews.Author: Judy Sardello "Multi Inquisitive"
Reviews.Content: The T5i has some new features over the T3i which I have.  I don't know about the T4i.  I have been a Canon user for  years and will remain a loyal one.  One feature I was intrigued with before I bought the camera was the RESIZE.  For a high jpeg, in the camera you can resize it in a new file, still keeping the original one, for emailing.  A great feature because it will save some much time over doing it in the computer.  Another  feature that I suspect will be very popular is the LCD touch screen.  You can change settings by activating the usual dials, etc., or you can simply use the LCD and tap on what you want to change.  My camera is brand new, so I have not tried that feature yet, but I have watched it being done on the instructional DVD I bought.  It's a little lighter weight with a slightly rubberized coating to make the camera easier to hold.  One of the most important features is that the standard lens has been updated to a much finer one.  The focusing is very quick.  The built-in flash has also been updated.  This camera does everything you could possibly want it to do....unless of course you are willing to pay $2000 or so for one.  I'm most pleased with mine.  As I say, I haven't used it much yet, but from my experience  so far it has been a dream.  Not one single complaint.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Has Fidanken
Reviews.Content: Super Camera. I bought it even knowing it has little more than the T4i. It is a very good entry DSLR camera, I am delighted with the quality of this thing!

Reviews.Title: More controls
Reviews.Author: Bernie
Reviews.Content: Nicer to operate than the Rebel T3I. Like the way all the options are easy to read on the display

Reviews.Title: Great camera as expected.
Reviews.Author: Patrick Kohler
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. It is very similar to the T3i but I felt that the extra features were enough. Definitely do your research and figure out what you want. It may save you a couple hundred dollars.

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: This camera is far better than I could have imagined. Very responsive and great for a first DSLR. I would recomend this camera to the person who wants that little bit more!

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Seth
Reviews.Content: I am a newbie in taking pictures, I've come from point-and-shoot. I've used it as point-and-shoot and love the intelligence built into this thing. I recommend using it for any events and vacations as long as you have a couple lenses for various settings. It is quick capturing with high speed memory sticks.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Upgrade!
Reviews.Author: Katherine James
Reviews.Content: Great product...takes unbelievabley clear pictures. I am so excited about it, I even signed up for a photo class to really learn what all the camera can really do!

Reviews.Title: Faulty lens
Reviews.Author: Pamela Gusmer
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is fine - the problem is the 18-135mm lens that shipped with it.  This was a "spare lens" for me in a range that I do not use frequently.  I put it on once and it seemed to work so I packed away.  I recently went to an event where I wanted this lens and noticed that the manual focus does not work.  The focus ring is loose and does nothing - only the auto focus works which doesn't work for all needs.  I am beyond the return window (only 30 days) so this is very disappointing on something so expensive.  Unfortunately with Amazon I am unsure how to contact for replacement.

Reviews.Title: Great first DSLR.
Reviews.Author: Zinger "Zinger"
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital SLR and has many of the features I wanted and more. I researched pretty extensively and I'm pretty happy with the results. I'm not doing anything for print yet but I'm doing some model photography (both studio and location) and some actor's head shots that are used as down-res files after being retouched and color-balanced. It's working out really well. I think if I'd had a bigger budget I would have gone for a full frame model (like the D5), rather than a Rebel model which all have the APS-C sensor. Being a visual effects professional I'm rather sensitive to having the best possible resolution, so this format is a compromise for someone who is used to always working with the best gear. The camera has been able to capture everything I've expected from it so far. It's fairly intuitive to use if you're a somewhat educated photographer. Beginners will take some time before they become fully conversant with all the cameras features but it won't stop them taking great pictures almost immediately.

Reviews.Title: A completely up-to-date, practical and useful SLR for the amateur and the enthusiast
Reviews.Author: Bob Folkman
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything you need it to, and reasonably well, if you are not a professional photographer.  But as an upgrade from a T3i or certainly from a T4i, it's not worth the extra investment.

Reviews.Title: No Complaints - So far I love it!!!
Reviews.Author: LS "LS"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a DSLR and I also shoot video - so this was naturally the camera for me.It was right at my price point of $1000, and comes with a fast focusing 18-135 lens.  Perfect if you don't want to switch out lenses (this is a do-it-all lens).Plus - if you are planning on any video - the improvements in the T5i over the T41 are meant for YOU!Right size, Right price, Right performance, Right quality ... no complaints at all.  Great camera for the $$$Thanks Canon!

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel T5i Digital SLR Camera and 18-135mm EF-S IS STM Lens Kit
Reviews.Author: fworth
Reviews.Content: Got this carmera with super fast shipping (standard shipping)!  Canon Rebel is worth every penny ! I got this to take everyday photo and for vacations. Its very light weight and the 18-135mmm lens is all I need at the moment ! Very happy camper !Update: So far the carmera shoots awesome photos...just order a new lens the  Canon EF 70-300mm f/4-5.6L IS USM UD Telephoto Zoom Lens for Canon EOS SLR Cameras will let you know how the lens works with the T5i soon !!

Reviews.Title: If you're a Canon fan it's perfect
Reviews.Author: Kelly Reynolds
Reviews.Content: It's everything you need, except maybe a few optional lenses, but to each his own. The 18-135mm is very versatile to start with.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: Jacob Schroeder
Reviews.Content: Just as described and a very nice camera. Recommend this camera to anyone who wants to do pictures . .

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Steven Rosen "Steve"
Reviews.Content: Got this at the last minute for a trip to Italy (needed to replace a 10 year-old Digital Rebel that started acting up two days before we were leaving). Anyone who has ever used a Canon DSLR will feel right at home using this model, the improvements in auto-focus alone are worth the upgrade, not to mention the ability to shoot full HD video. The 18-135mm lens is only slightly heavier than the 18-85mm, but gives you a whole lot more flexibility in composing shots. Great for walking around all day (playing tourist). The touch screen display gives you quick access to the menus, and provides a sharp, clear display (with smartphone-like zooming) to do image reviews quickly and easily.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as an upgrade from my rebel XT. The first thing I noticed was how fast it focused. Along with the bright display. Great camera and great photos/videos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Ankita
Reviews.Content: I have used a t4i in the past and the t5i is no different from that for clicking photographs - Brilliant in every regard. Moreover, the new STM lens is amazing for video. There is no noise while switching focus and is a big improvement while capturing video. In all, an amazing entry level DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and lens.
Reviews.Author: Desert Rat
Reviews.Content: Got the camera for upcoming trip and have been shooting a lot to get up to speed.  Great pictures in every mode I've tried.  The ability to shoot hd video as well as photos is wonderful.  Need a fast memory card to shoot video.  I bought a two battery add-on which I find useful.

Reviews.Title: Your gonna love it
Reviews.Author: Mom2Three
Reviews.Content: We have the original Rebel and many lenses and were super excited to finally upgrade our base.  Very happy with the new T5i and back in love with taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Cannon ESO T5i Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: KATHY B.
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I expected, this camera is everything you will need to take beautiful pictures of every kind. Portraits, landscape, and action shots. Very simple to use, and excellent craftsmanship. Looking forward to many years of fun!

Reviews.Title: What a difference
Reviews.Author: BRADLEY CHALK
Reviews.Content: Compare shots taken with your existing camera and the T5i.  I did so with a very nice Canon point and shoot 12.1 and was amazed.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Joshua Wickey
Reviews.Content: I really like the T5i as the automatic functions are excellent and the manual control is easy to set.  I also like the on-board editing features.

Reviews.Title: The Best of the Rebel Cameras
Reviews.Author: Mike M. "Mike M."
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced my Canon T2i.  The T5i is a great replacement for a camera I enjoyed for years.  I have a 4 year old grandson who will not pose for a picture, the FPS is great.  I have even used the auto setting for several shots and the outcome was great.  The flash is fine for close up shots, but for distance I got a Canon 260.  Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Adam L.
Reviews.Content: Came quickly and as described.  The wife LOVES the 18-135 lens, a HUGE improvement over the standard 18-55 that most people get.  Bought this over the 6D because it has some newer technology inside comparatively, so some google searches to find out specific differences, and to 98% of the people out there, you'd never use the camera to the potential that you'd notice.  If you were to, you would be investing in a 3k dollar camera.  Don't regret this a bit, and would buy again!

Reviews.Title: nice!
Reviews.Author: ,Heather
Reviews.Content: Still learning how to use all the different settings, but so far the pictures I've take have been great.  Nice camera

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Paul M.
Reviews.Content: We bought this for taking family pictures and movies! It has been absolutely perfect! We both are very pleased customers!

Reviews.Title: Its great
Reviews.Author: margaret howard
Reviews.Content: it was a gift but they thought it is the best ever.very clear and perfect color pictures easy to use

Reviews.Title: Great prosumer still camera
Reviews.Author: Walter F. from Chicago
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to write a whole lot about this camera as I see there are already a few very in-depth reviews. I will say that this is a great stills camera. I think they have a little ways to go with the video portion of things but you can see they are working hard on this category from their creation of the STM lenses.

Reviews.Title: packing of t5i
Reviews.Author: charles sadler
Reviews.Content: i have never seen such nice and neat packing done was suprized when i opened it up impressed well done AAAAAA+++++++++++++++

Reviews.Title: Canon is Class
Reviews.Author: BW
Reviews.Content: I've used my two 35 mm film cameras since 1970. They have served me well. Moving into the digital age, I opted for the T5 for it's latest features. What can I say? Canon is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera

Reviews.Content: this is a great camera - easy to use and wonderful pictures.  The size is also good, not too big.

Reviews.Title: Xmas Gift for my daughter, who loved it!
Reviews.Author: Gift Card "Review Nation"
Reviews.Content: This was purchased for my daughter who is a novice photographer, and she loves it. She has had it for a year now and it still works just fine. I've used it a couple times on photo shoots, and the photos turned out lovely and professional quality. Highly recommended for beginners, novice and even profession photographers who want a nice camera with all the bells and whistles without spending and arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: Excellent

As technological advances, offers touch display, which is easily the most. This is another great product from Canon.

Reviews.Title: thankyou

Reviews.Content: thank you for this products, i WAS kinda surprised there is no case for this camera, but other than that, it was perfect

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Deborah Tanner
Reviews.Content: We already have two canons but the increase in MP is very noticeable in picture quality.  I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: M. Merriken
Reviews.Content: Was a birthday gift for someone and apparently they love it, you need an SD card for it, not in the box, they love it said  how easy it is to use!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: ChefMark
Reviews.Content: I'm new to DSLR a camera, I have always had a point and shoot type.  The T5i is a great camera to start learning about digital photography.UpdateAfter a few months of using the 5Ti it is a great camera.  I have used it for sporting events and some still photos the camera makes me look like I know what I'm doing.

Reviews.Title: Yes, Ilove it.
Reviews.Author: Diomedes Ventura "Diomedes Ventura"
Reviews.Content: I'd been upgrading from a SX30 to the T5i. I like Canon quality, build and support, really a great camera for a amateur like me. I having fun. lots of it.

Reviews.Title: cannon maddness

Reviews.Content: Its don't gei any better than this, I've own a bu nch of cannon cameras in the past but cannon just keep out doing its self I recommend that you try this camera out just for starter. I promise you you will not want to put it down.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Robnel
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR, I'm joining the photography world and couldn't be happier, you can't go wrong with this camera, pictures and videos are amazing!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Dr Fareed Rajack FRCS (Glasg) Ophth
Reviews.Content: The camera is well built and very user friendly . The pictures are outstanding . This is an excellent dslr camera for entry level and certainly worth the price.

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR since my Film SLR
Reviews.Author: Chip50
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent product to use and understand for someone that is just getting into DSLR or someone that is transitioning from a point and shoot. Also fits well in my hand vs the Nikon DSLR of the same size.

Reviews.Title: superb
Reviews.Author: jackjpritchard
Reviews.Content: great camera. hightly recommended! the low light pics on this camera using the 18-55 mm lens are really surprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: difficult to use, cannot use aftermarket batteries
Reviews.Author: Donny Brassco
Reviews.Content: The camera takes amazing pictures - when it wants to.The settings are not very intuative and I find myself constantly having to read the manual to find out why it is refusing to take a picture.When in video mode the autofocus is nearly useless.  This makes filming yourself darn near impossible because someone has to be "At the helm" constantly adjusting the autofocus which should be renamed to headache generator.I am constantly having to reset everything back to default settings, even though I have simply stopped changing them.Will only work with canon batteries.  Not a big deal but annoying when so many companies claim to make compatible batteries.

Reviews.Title: IM IN LOVE
Reviews.Author: rod
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS REBEL HANDS DOWN ITS MY FAV IF YOU DONT HAVE THIS YOU REALLY NEED TO GET THIS

Reviews.Title: After buying this camera, I saw the rebate on Nikon 5300.
Reviews.Author: Tim "opinions are like..."
Reviews.Content: Disappointed to see the Nikon for nearly the same price with similar lens had wifi, GPS and 1080P video,  Too late to change now.This camera should have been cheaper given the Nikon features/pricing.

Reviews.Title: Awsome
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: The best! I guess everybody should have one of this...The quality of the pictures is surreal.I am very satisfect...

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Honghui
Reviews.Content: It is a good and fundarmental camera for the begainer who would like to explore digital single lens feflex camara. In a word, I like it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Wolf
Reviews.Content: Purchased this unit in April when it first came out -Motherboard failed 4 days ago - shutter trigger would not release, then it would continious shoot (even in a mode that does not call for it) - but it would indicate that the trigger was releasingMenue function as well as preview function would not work - essentially the entire camera failedDropped it off at my local Canon dealer for repair (but still being charged the money for shipping)This is not my first Rebel - been using them since they first appeared over 7 years ago, but the first to fail.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: Nicki Miller
Reviews.Content: My 2nd Canon Rebel series camera. So far I'm very happy with it's features and performance. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: John Andrews
Reviews.Content: Works with my other Canon lens.  Need to take more vacations so I can use this camera.  Hopefully, it doesn't break on me like the D50 I purchased a few years back.  Out of warranty the cameras are expensive to repair.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR!!!!
Reviews.Author: A-Tan
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace a point and shoot, Canon Powershot SD1000.It takes great pictures and has a lot of features.I would recommend this camera to an avid photographer.

Reviews.Title: Canon quality control is going downhill
Reviews.Author: thank you
Reviews.Content: the grip of this camera feels flimsy, and the sensor have two hot pixels ( I have to re-map it in order to resolve the problem, but I don't feel comfortable to re-map a brand new camera sensor)I am having a lot of troubles with Canon camera and lenses recently, all bought from authorized retailers, including amazon LLC.  what's wrong with Canon????I bought Canon 6D, found to have hot pixels and mirror/focus screen dusts.I bought Canon 70D, auto-focus was problematic with my Canon EF 300mm F4 L IS USM lensI bought Canon t5i , and the problems happened again with built quality and hot pixels.I bought Canon 70-300mm F4-5.6 L IS USM white telephoto zoom lens from Profeel Media Inc, can not produce sharp pictures, called Canon tech support, they confirmed to me something could be wrong with the Image Stabilization system.Is there something wrong with Amazon's inventory, or is Canon really going Down hill in quality control?What's going on , come on Canon???  ! ! !

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: TC
Reviews.Content: A little loud. The shutter is fast but loud, nice for taking action shots. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Alexandre Alves
Reviews.Content: So far I'm very happy with it's features and performance. The only thing I do not like was the video shooting.

Reviews.Title: Wost video shooting experience of all !
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: What a shame Canon ! Video shooting out of focus and blurry most of time ! With STM lens, slow focus is in an out during recording several time.  I have a 50 sec video, and my kid was out of focus for 20 sec in a sunny day. Starting with out of focus in recording, and it stays in out of focus for more than few sec as it has in sleep.  All right, you can press the shutter to refocus again, but slowly focus in and out last over 5 sec in recording would make you quit !  I learned how to shoot a nice video with manual focus like pro !  Bought this camera for Seattle Vancouver trip, and it is wasted.  You are losing your good name and creditbility. Own 3 Canon but 1st in SLR. Better come out firmware to fix this problem.  Get a Lumix G5 or G6 for video quality is super.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: T. Okorie "Rockjunkie"
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera I have purchased in over a decade. Not sure yet how it all works but I am glad I got this.

Reviews.Title: Does NOT compare to Nikon D5200
Reviews.Author: Crabber
Reviews.Content: Have owned the T5i for about two weeks, we purchased at Costco as a full bundle kit with the 18-55mm and the 55-250mm lens. We previously had purchased the Nikon D5200 bundle and decided to compare with the CanonT5i(my idea as I thought Canon would be a better camera). Boy was I shocked at the difference in quality from everything to camera body to picture quality, the Nikon blows away this T5i in just about every scenario with the one exception of touch screen which is not a big deal and uses up the battery extremely fast. The T5i is a nice camera but falls short in too many important specifications:image quality, color depth, dynamic range, low light performance, focus points, mega pixels, not to mention it has plastic lens mounts. The T5i went back and we are sooo happy to have the Nikon D5200 back, there is no question between these two cameras, the Nikon out performs the Canon T5i in every single category mentioned above and has metal lens mounting(important to me as the lenses are were the $$$ is). The Nikon is way more camera and the larger lens is 55-300mm not to mention the 24.1 Mega Pixels compared to T5i's 18 Mega Pixels, also the Nikon package comes with a wireless adapter that allows you to send pics to your phone and use your phone as a live remote to see through your camera lens at the same time. If you are in doubt check out snapsort website to compare every detail side by side. For my $$$, there is no comparison and you feel the difference in build quality as soon as you pick up the cameras.

Reviews.Title: Camera arrived without the lens
Reviews.Author: D. Medlin
Reviews.Content: If you buy this camera, make sure to check the box well before you need it. Mine arrived with the body and no lens.

Reviews.Title: okey
Reviews.Author: ravi sharma
Reviews.Content: more of plasticky feel & results are not good if move beyond 1600 ISOok for entry level but nort upto the mark

Reviews.Title: Stop!!!! Do not buy if you don't have PhotoShop CS6
Reviews.Author: Justin Pitman
Reviews.Content: So, I was so excited to finally get a DSLR. I took the camera out to shoot and all went fine, the touch screen made things really quick and easy....Then I got home. I currently have Adobe PhotoShop CS5 and had problems viewing the photos I took. Apon searching the net I found out that the T5i will not work with any photoshop older than CS6. This is such bull S@%&!!! To clarify, I now have to buy a $1000 program to view my photos taken on a $800 camera. This is bull S&^$. If customer service can't give me a good work around this thing is going back.

Reviews.Title: Such a bad experience with Amazon. Never Expected it. - 04/16/2014
Reviews.Author: Sidhartha
Reviews.Content: Reg Order # 109-0249939-3528247I bought a Canon Rebel T5i Digital SLR Camera and 18-55mm EF-S IS STM Lens Kit with few other items from Amazon on last Thursday April 10th 2014.If i would have bought this product from thirdy party seller selling in amazon site, i would have got it cheaper. The only reason i chosed to buy directly from Amazon was i want to get the best product. While buying the product, it was showing estimate delivery date was Apr 14th. But while i was tracking the product on 13th night, i discoverd that the estimate date automatically moved to 15th April.When i called customer care, they were saying it was an estimate date, but we never guranteed that we will deliver on 14th.Anyhow they gave me a promotional cupon for this late delivery and i was ok with that. I recieved the product on 15th April. But when i opened the package, i found that there was no seal on the cannon box and to my surprise the 18-55mm lens was missing in the box.When i called customer care and told that the lens was missing, first he said might be it was a mistake from their side and they sent only the body only package. But when i informed him that the seal was broken and in the box contents it has the lens mentioned, then he said somebody might have tampered it in the warehouse before dispatching.How come a company like Amazon will do these kind of mistake? I cancelled the camera order and today i am going to return the camera back to Amazon.Also i have decided not to buy the camera from Amazon at least. I lost all my interest and faith on Amazon.I will buy it from some other vendor.The customer care person was offering me a 5$ promotional cupon for compensating the trouble and inconvinience i faced. I denied the offer. They thought 5$ is the amount to compensate the trouble i faced and the mistake they made. I would say you just lost one customer .I am posting this, because i want other people also should know this incident and decide properly before buying any expensive item from amazon.

Reviews.Title: good camera but should hv more accessories added...
Reviews.Author: Puneet Chadha
Reviews.Content: Was expecting a SD card with it......could hv been better with a SD card camera cover and a tripod stand

Reviews.Title: Save your money, buy the T4i and get a better camera!
Reviews.Author: NoLongerDemure
Reviews.Content: The only real improvement this camera has over the T4i is a longer battery life. In fact, in almost every other aspect it is inferior to the T4i. Compare the stats of two cameras side by side and you will see what I mean. Check out snapshot ratings for the spelled out difference.

ProductInfo.Features:
EOS Full HD Movie mode with Movie Servo AF for continuous focus tracking of moving subjects, manual exposure control and multiple frame rates built-in stereo microphone, manual audio level adjustment and Video Snapshot
Vari-angle touchscreen 3.0-inch Clear View LCD monitor II (approximately 1,040,000 dots) with smudge-resistant coating features multi-touch operation and Touch AF
18.0 megapixel CMOS (APS-C) sensor, 14-bit A/D conversion, ISO 100-12800 (expandable to H: 25600) for shooting from bright to dim light and high performance
9-point all cross-type AF system (including a high-precision dual-cross f/2.8 center point) for exceptional autofocus performance when shooting with the viewfinder and Hybrid CMOS AF
Includes EF-S18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS STM high magnification standard zoom lens with Optical Image Stabilizer for up to four equivalent stops of shake correction
